projects.title: Shopping Research Generator
projects.shortDescription: Because googling 'best [thing] 2024' apparently isn't good enough anymore
projects.description: A glorified form that generates overly detailed shopping research prompts. Perfect for when you want to spend 3 hours researching a $20 purchase like the responsible adult you pretend to be.

projects.title: Stock Analytics Widget
projects.shortDescription: Fancy graphs that make losing money look scientific
projects.description: A stock analysis tool with more buttons and charts than I know what to do with. Features Monte Carlo simulations because apparently regular mistakes weren't random enough. Helps you lose money with confidence and statistical backing.

projects.title: Monte Carlo Particle Simulation
projects.shortDescription: My attempt to make chemistry look like a screensaver
projects.description: 3D particle simulation that bounces dots around the screen while pretending to do actual science. Uses the Metropolis algorithm, which sounds way more impressive than it actually is. Perfect for when you want to feel smart about physics you half-remember from college.

projects.title: Dodgers Win = Cheap Panda Express
projects.shortDescription: The most important public service I've ever provided
projects.description: Dodgers win at home = free orange chicken at Panda Express. This is literally the only sports betting tip that actually matters. Sign up to get notified when your local Panda Express becomes a goldmine of free mediocre Chinese food.

projects.title: Public Art Submission Form
projects.shortDescription: For when you see something cool and want to tell the internet about it
projects.description: A mobile-friendly form that lets you document street art, murals, and other cool stuff you find while wandering around. Takes your photo, grabs your location, and hopefully doesn't crash your phone. Results may vary.

projects.title: Public Art Interactive Map
projects.shortDescription: All the cool art stuff people found, on a map that might actually work
projects.description: An interactive map that shows all the street art and murals people have submitted. Built with Google Maps because I wasn't brave enough to make my own mapping system. Sometimes the photos load, sometimes they don'tâ€”it's a fun surprise every time.
